verbs.description: parallelize (third-person singular simple present parallelizes, present participle parallelizing, simple past and past participle parallelized)

examples: Care must be taken lest the machine parallelize the fibers.

entries.meaning: (programming) To make to execute in parallel.
examples: The programmers had to learn how to parallelize their algorithms.

entries.meaning: To treat as if parallel; to draw parallels between.
examples: They erroneously parallelized the symptoms of the two diseases.
